result.execSummary:
The defendant Domonique Marquis Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Third Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to count 4.  Credit for 165 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with victim.
No contact with firearms.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges including the DNA and victim witness surcharge, assessments are to be collected by DOC at maximum rate from the defendant's prison wages and any other funds and during extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment/tax intercept.
Court waives all nonmandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-Restitution set at zero.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

-Court ordered defendant to register as a sex offender, mandatory 15 years.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to count 1.  Credit for 165 days time served.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Domonique Marquis Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Domonique Marquis Smith.  Attorney Emily S Zimmel in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for sentencing hearing. Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. Additional statement made by Thelma B.

AS TO COUNT 1.  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 88 MONTHS, consecutive to COUNT 4, with credit for 165 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 56 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 36 MONTHS. 
-Court ordered defendant to register as a Sex Offender; mandatory 15 years.

AS TO COUNT 4.  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 44 MONTHS, consecutive to COUNT 1, with credit for 165 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 20 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS. 

*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-No contact with victim.
-No contact with firearms.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-Restitution set at zero.
-The court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) assessments are to be collected by DOC at MAXIMUM rate from the defendant's prison wages and any other funds and during extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment/tax intercept.  

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. 

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Domonique Marquis Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Domonique Marquis Smith.  Attorney Emily S Zimmel in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in Court for continued jury trial.

Discussion held regarding waiver of element stipulation. Court will not accept stipulation at this time. Defense informs Court that defendant wishes to take the State's offer. Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 

Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 3 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 4.
 
Defendant examined as to pleas, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Court ordered defendant REMANDED pending sentencing. Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 36.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Domonique Marquis Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Domonique Marquis Smith.  Attorney Emily S Zimmel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Jury panel in box at 1:24 PM. Voir dire continued. Fourteen (14) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed. Court instructed jury.  

Jury out of box at 2:58 PM. Strikes for cause placed on the record. Court takes a short recess for parties to address other matters. 

Jury in box at 3:55 PM. Opening statements by state. Defense is reserving the right to make an opening statement. Court adjourns case. Jurors instructed not to research or discuss the case, to return at 9:00 AM. Jury out of box at 4:08 PM. Case is adjourned.

Defendant Domonique Marquis Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Domonique Marquis Smith.  Attorney Emily S Zimmel in court for State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for jury trial. Discussion held regarding jury instructions. Court ordered witnesses sequestered. Discussion regarding Motion in Limine. 


Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:18 AM.  Jury out of box at 11:35 AM. Instructed to return at 1:20 PM. Defendant is requesting a court trial. Colloquy held with defendant, defendant requesting jury trial. Case is passed to 1:30.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Domonique Marquis Smith. Defendant Domonique Marquis Smith not in court, in custody.   Attorney Emily S Zimmel in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Jury Trial. Court will be in trial on another matter. Case spun to Branch 36 Judge Crivello.
Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Domonique Marquis Smith. Defendant Domonique Marquis Smith in court, in custody.    Attorney Emily S Zimmel in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Final Pretrial. In chambers discussion held. Case remains in a jury trial posture. Negotiations placed on the record. Defendant rejects States offer. Court will select a back up jury trial date  Jury trial remains scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 8:15 am, Branch 38.
Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Domonique Marquis Smith. Defendant Domonique Marquis Smith not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Kenneth Olstinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Final Pretrial. Case remains in a jury trial posture. State requests a new final pretrial date. No pending issues remain. Case adjourned, Branch 38.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Bail motion by Defense argued and partially GRANTED by the Court.  Cash Bond lowered to $15,000.00.
Speedy trial demand. EXPIRES 11-7-2022.

Defendant Domonique Marquis Smith in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Domonique Marquis Smith in custody.  Jessica Bellows on behalf of Emily Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for an Arraignment.  Original information e-filed; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty, enters a speedy trial demand and request matter set on the trial calendar.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing. All motions to be filed within 21 days. Any evidentiary matters will be heard on the final pretrial date. Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Case being called at an earlier time.  State has complied with victim notification.  Counsel waives the defendant's appearance.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Brostrom.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
MOTION FOR BAIL MODIFICATION, received and filed.

Defendant Domonique Marquis Smith in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran; both appear by video.  Defendant Domonique Marquis Smith in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 21CF3223.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective S. Wells. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense request an arraignment date and to be heard on bail on the next date.
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04E (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Arraignment scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
ALL CONDITIONS REMAIN AS PREVIOUSLY SET.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $20,000 CASH

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.
